items.content_html: I am trying something out: some Blog-Gardening in Public, i.e. working-in-public on (some) of my bigger essays and idea-pieces. I don’t know of many folks doing things like this, but I hope to help normalize it, because it seems good! More thoughts here.
items.content_text: I am trying something out: some [Blog-Gardening in Public](https://v5.chriskrycho.com/journal/blog-gardening-in-public/), i.e. working-in-public on (some) of my bigger essays and idea-pieces. I don't know of many folks doing things like this, but I hope to help normalize it, because it seems good! More thoughts [here](https://v5.chriskrycho.com/journal/blog-gardening-in-public/).

items.content_html: My wife ordered me the LEGO Saturn V model for a Christmas present, and it finally arrived yesterday. Doing this is: unreasonably fun.

items.content_html: It only took me five years (or was it six?) to finish migrating all of my old, no-longer-updated sites out of the shared hosting I used to use (â€¦so, you know, just an extra $300 I paid over the years ğŸ™ƒ) but as of today I have finally shut that account down. Feels good!

items.content_html: Finally able to spend some time with Dorico v4.3 and I love that in addition to all the feature improvements it landed, it also got some love in terms of just little bits of polishâ€”e.g. the popovers are all just a little bit nicer-looking.
items.content_text: Finally able to spend some time with [Dorico](https://www.steinberg.net/dorico/) v4.3 and I love that in addition to all the feature improvements it landed, it also got some love in terms of just little bits of polishâ€”e.g. the popovers are all just a little bit nicer-looking.

items.content_html: Just published a new write-up on the difference between doing things like â€œrestructuring your notes systemâ€ (puttering, even if productive) and â€œactually working on the essay your notes are theoretically forâ€ (generative work).

items.content_text: As mentioned earlier, Iâ€™m quite bullish on [Readwise](https://readwise.io/i/chris4201u) and its Reader so farâ€”but I have some pretty significant differences with the folks behind it philosophicallyâ€¦ as I cover in [this Readwise Reader-annotated](https://readwise.io/reader/shared/01gnxbcjfm97fyn4jyeq4msq54/) version of their Reader manifesto. ğŸ˜

items.content_html: Pretty strong first impressions here right out of the gate for Readwiseâ€”its Obsidian integration in particular is pretty neat, and I think will solve an annoyance I have had for a long time with any â€œweb clippingâ€/bookmarking system: its disconnect form my notes.
items.content_text: Pretty strong first impressions here right out of the gate for [Readwise](https://readwise.io/i/chris4201u)â€”its [Obsidian integration](https://readwise.io/obsidian_export) in particular is pretty neat, and I think will solve an annoyance I have had for a *long* time with any â€œweb clippingâ€/bookmarking system: its disconnect form my notes.

items.content_html: The one thing I would very much like from the Koboâ€“Pocket integration is: the ability to use the Kobo highlighting to sync highlights to Pocket. (Or to save them locally!) Yes, that would require a Pocket subscription, but it would still be excellent.
items.content_text: The one thing I would *very* much like from [the Koboâ€“Pocket integration](https://help.kobo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360017763753-Use-the-Pocket-App-with-your-Kobo-eReader) is: the ability to use the Kobo highlighting to sync highlights to Pocket. (Or to save them locally!) Yes, that would require a Pocket subscription, but it would still be *excellent*.
